column1: Friendly staff members and ideal area for my visit
Staff including housekeeping were very amicable and accommodating
location was excellent - only a short walk from the city centre and many of the city's attractions
accommodation was great - excellent value, comfortable beds and clean
also very convenient for travel connections
our double room was booked a month in advance, we got a phone call when we were 5 minutes away to say we had to put up with a twin room
not very professional
Excellent staff who were very attentive, very keen to make sure we had an enjoyable stay
Beautiful rooms finished to a high standard, delicious food and excellent service
Bedrooms were grotty and bed so uncomfortable
The phone was also broken
The hotel was full of hens and stags
I thought the hotel was very pricey for what you got
Wouldn't stay here again
Reception lady was very polite and accommodating
Rooms were perfect for what we needed and the shower was so strong, I think i came out of it a stone lighter:-) loved it
Staff at reception was rude and demanded to see our id's to see if we were of age to book a room
We were well aware that you had to be over 18, but even after showing our id's we still very rude to us and didn't make us feel welcome at all
Very good location close to central railway station
Room quite small and cramped, especially with normal luggage for two people
rooms dont have cards, old keys

the room was full of ants who came out every day around the drawer and garbage bin -there is no internet - wifi for 5 to 10 euros limited to 1 connection at a time -very busy street (intersection) and very noisy
at night the location is kind of scary and unsafe

-very thin walls - we could here a guy coughing his lungs out one night (and spitting) - very disgusting -poor breakfast - mostly pastry -the rooms facing front are above a restaurant and the entrance - dont leave the window open or you'll get cigarette smoke and hear everybody screaming, laughing, etc, even late at night
Front desk staff is very helpful and polite
It's only few minutes from Termini and good restaurants nearby
Takes about 15-20 min walk to Colosseum
Great location, very close to the central train station (ideal for early/late transfers to the airports) walking distance to Romes city centre and sites
Tasty breakfast, overall a great place to stay
Good location, kind stuff, but no free wi fi
very good location, staff very good and friendly, nice room and bathroom too
excellent value
my room window was facing the street which is full of life but I was happy to hear the voice of Roma the eternal city
I love this hotel, Thanks
The location is very good
Near to republic square
The price is acceptable
The room was very clean, a very comfortable bed and if you are going to travel by train, the location is perfect
Showers are very small
Location is near train station and subway station
Very good Italian restaurant just at the corner
Big taxi from hotel to airport is Euro 48 (we had 4 big luggage and 3 small bags) Breakfast is considered good
Good location - close to the train and metro stations, ready to help English speaking gentlemen at the reception, clean room, with special gadget to charge three devices at once, smiling chambermaids
The room was very small and it smelled like mildew
The hotel hasn't been updated in quite some time
The location, 5 minutes away from Termini rail station
The room was clean, the staff was friendly
It was a pleasant and cozy stay
Fantastic location, fairly decent breakfast and very comfortable place to stay
They had no coffee or tea available in the bedroom or somewhere public where you could help yourself or even pay for it in the evening or late afternoon
We did a late checkin, we never stayed at this hotel, instead they upgraded us to their nearby 4 star hotel which was very nice
When we told them we had a morning flight they packed us a very nice healthy breakfast for all of us
which we had in flight,very nice stay,comfortable
This hotel enjoys a good location as it is a few minutes away from the train terminal
It is good for those who have already arrived from other places
Staff members are OK too
It is also good for those who want to enjoy Chinese meals, as there is one Chinese restaurant next to the hotel's door
The location was perfect, close to Termini station and you can easily walk from there to whatever in Rome
The breaktfast was so much better than I expected.  A lot to choose from.
The staff was so nice and helpful

Room was hot, air didn't work, room was small (even for Europe), no wifi, bugs, no shampoo etc, bathroom was bright pink, staff was not friendly, had to leave key with hotel when we left, tiny coffin size elevator, noisy
Near the Bus/Train Station so very easy to get around
Not overly loud or polluted, so was able to have the window open
Provided a map of the city
Restaurants within a few metres
The hotel is very nice
It was very clean and comfortable
The staff were friendly
Good breakfast and good location
The first room we got was infested with flies
The hotel moved us and the second room was better
Breakfast poor and limited choice
Rooms ok and dated
Bathroom particularly cramped
Wasn't overly impressed with hotel for the money we paid
Reception staff were always helpful and pleasant, they were happy to go out of their way to help you
Breakfasts were more than adequate
Rooms and bathroom were spotless and airconditioning worked very well
Overall it is a fantastic place to stay whilst is rome and as it is centrally located especially to termini station
NO air conditioning room very HOT NO Internet which was meant to be free wifi
Very good location, neat to buses, train and by working distances to many interesting places
Hotels looks old but isnide is like a new one
The breakfast was simple but very good for us
The Location of the hotel is great, less than 5mins walk from the train station and within walkable distance from all attractions
The room is clean & WIFI connection is good
The staffs at the hotel were very helpful & friendly
The hotel staff are very friendly and help you find your way around
They even called restaurants for us and made bookings so we could make sure we got a table for the evening
The bathroom was a little small but that's typical for European hotels
It was the best hotel we stayed at during our trip to Italy (Rome, Florence, Milan)
The interiors were absolutely wonderful, the room was spacious and the beds were so comfortable
The wifi works well, the buffet breakfast is great too
The ambiance was perfect
And it's a 5 minute walk from most of the sites and a 3minute walk from the Santa Maria Novella station
I don't know why it's a 7 , 8 in booking com, in my book, it's a 10
Staying here again the next time I visit Firenze
The hotel is placed on what is probably one of the most nosiest streets in Firenze
As such, at lower floors is quite noisy
very very very good staff
Good location
We stayed this hotel only one night
The location was perfect
I've done with my running in the morning for 30 minutes and realized that most of places were within walking distance
We went for shopping along the street between Duomo and the hotel
Also we found a really good restaurant just one minute from the hotel

This hotel is small, cozy, clean and comfortable, the room was small, but enought for 2 people, breakfast is not very rich, but tasty, location is perfect, 2 minutes walk from the Termini and about 7 minutes walk to the Duomo, so, in my next visit in Firenze, I without any doubt will chouse in this hotel again
Very good location
close to everything
Nice and friendly staffs always ready to help
Good and fresh breakfast and lots of selection
Has a lift
Good bed and clean towels
Book all my tours and was very please
The shower seem to be not so clean and the wifi was very weak
Good hotel
Nice breakfast
Condition
Very good location
The hotel is right on a busy street which can be noisy until quite late
Double glazed windows helped a lot
Rooms are a bit small
at night there is a loottt of noise outside and they clean the street at 3am
My husband coulent sleep all night but if u close the window
u should b fine we didnt wana use the ac
The staff was great
All of them were very helpful and very welcoming and friendly
The location is great, very close to the train/bus station and well within walking distance to a great majority of the tourist sites
The hotel was great for setting up tours and really went above and beyond in customer service
Reception staff rude and advised friend that they had resold his room before the arrival cut off time which left us in separate hotels
excellent staff, amazing breakfast, new designer rooms, super wifi
what else can someone ask for
oh yes, location was just perfect
The shower curtain did not work properly, my bathroom was soaked after each shower
The location is close to the train station, but doesn't feel really safe for a woman to walk alone at night
The staff is not friendly and without any smile
The hotel kept our passport after check-in, which I don't think is necessary
As I book a triple room, the extra bed is only a sofa bed which is short and small without blanket (with bed cover only)
Be careful they have a level of the hotel where the rooms have not been rennovated for a very long time
Felt like we had been taken advantage of and there was not much we could do
It seemed like everything was a veneer in this place
They gave us a crappy room
Totally different from the pictures from Booking
I could not understand and confronted the front desk
I was not coming in with tour group, why such lousy room, smelly carpets and old run down look
The front desk later realised that I booked via booking
com and the pictures from booking
com were looking modern, nice and clean, they changed our room for us
But this is bad impression
Just because I am not so European looking like person, so they can dump such room on us
We enjoyed our stay in this very nice hotel
It's very conveniently located
just a short walk from the train station and in a very quiet area
It's within easy walking distance of all the main attractions in Florence
It was great value for money and the Champagne breakfast was very adequate indeed
Apart from the usual continental fare there was also scrambled eggs and sausages available
We would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Florence
Great garden, but be careful of the mozzies
Lovely to have drink early evening or when baby napping
Useful to have that extra space
Room design was very modern
We really liked it
The rooms are quite small, but I guess that's normal in a city break
Some disappointment in the front desk staff
Some were abrupt when answering our questions
And I heard a front desk staff person tell a client checking in who asked about getting some hot water (presumably for a cup of tea) to "go to the bar"
There are electric "kettles" in the rooms
The reception staff where a bit nasty
And the cleans for the room should be sacked
We asked for milk in a nice letter since we where their for a few days and the cheekily rote back a rude letter
Then the next day didn't even tidy out cups or anything just made bed that was it
loved the futuristic decoration of the room, the staff were extremely kind and helpful, breakfast was fine too (although I was missing the raw ham)
Train station is very close
This is a good hotel
The only negative thing was that the "double bed" was two beds put together, and they were not even real beds, just matresses not fixed to the base
And they were also a bit softer than my taste
The location of the hotel was excellent, it was very close to the center
The staff at the reception was very friendly and helpful
The breakfast was excellent, the quality of food was very good
IÂ´d like the location, near to everything, and the breakfast
Location very close to the centre, tasty breakfast
The reception staff was kinder than that of most other European hotels I've been to
There was a free parking lot just 300~500m down the road from the hotel, which was very convenient
There was a small fitness that no one used in the evening, and I was able to have the whole place to myself
The room was perhaps not used for a while, and there was dust everywhere
The fitness room definitely needs more equipment, although I know most European 3~4 star hotels are like that
Great room and location, but senior gentleman that checked us in was abrupt and later on when asked a question that he was there to answer, made us feel like we were intruding
The staff was very friendly and helpfull
The breakfast buffet was amazing
The location was spot on, right next to everything
An exceptional stay,the staff went out of their way to assist us in all matters,including connecting us with stores when we enquirer about goods
Wifi was absolutely awful
Front desk staff were not incredibly helpful
the room was clean and comfortable , breakfast was good
the location is great the room was quit , and the front desk was kind and helpful
Breakfast was high standard and with attentive staff
Room and bed very comfy
Reception staff very efficient & helpful
All staff friendly
Convenient for station via escalator
Would stay here again and recommend it
Quadruple room initially booked is too small and does not match the pictures or descriptions
Had to change to two single rooms after the first night
Room Temperature control quirky at times
Insufficient soap bars in relation to number of guests
confortable rooms, good cleaning, excelent breakfast, very friendly staff and excelent location to visit Siena
Excellent hotel, ideal location take the scala mobile from the train/bus station turn right walk a few hundred meters and be pleasently surprised all around from the
great staff to confort of room and surprising breakfasts
We like the location which is close to train station and walking distance to all famous landmarks in Siena
We would like to specially thank reception staff, Cristina and Julia for being so helpful, friendly and for making our stay in Siena so nice, Grazie e arrivederci
Very clean and helpful staff
The bed was actually comfortable
Many beds overseas are horrible
The daily breakfast was very good
And they actually served at 7:30 am
So many hotels wouldn't serve breakfast till 8:30
So ridiculous
this hotel was excellent
We were upgraded to a superior triple room when we arrived which was away from the hotel
The room was lovely
The staff were excellent and the hotel very light and airy
Location was great with a 20 minute walk into the town
The staff were great and very helpful
Hotel bar and breakfast room were beautiful
We stayed in a wing of the hotel that was a little older in decor style but very clean and spacious for our family of four
Breakfast was very good
We used the pool at their sister hotel which was great
The breakfast room was too small for the number of guests
The tables were too close together and it was a very claustraphobic experience
Small bathroom
No outside light
The staff were excellent, their recommendations for eating out were brilliant
The breakfast was better than a four star we stayed at in Rome
Overall a very friendly and relaxing place to stay
20 minutes walking from the tourists place, unpleasant in the evening/ sun/ rain
No WiFi (only for money and per day per device), only 9 parking spaces
Some of the rooms are outside the main bulding
The staff of Hotel Italia are very helpful
They also replied to all my emails immediately and answered all my queries well
We enjoyed the variety of food served during breakfast
It was also so nice of them to surprise us with a yummy chocolate cake because we were celebrating our wedding anniversary
We wished we stayed longer in Hotel Italia and Siena
Hotel is on a main street so quite a bit of traffic noise through the night
However this was only a minor irritant and made up for by the positive features of the property
the spacious and newly decorated rooms were great
We particularly enjoyed the spacious bathroom and the balcony
the breakfast room and reception were really lovely
We arrived at the local station and the escalator through the shopping centre was the best shortcut to reach the hotel
The hotel is a pleasent 10/15 minutes walk away from the centre
There are lots of shops and places to eat along the way , We loved it
I stayed in this hotel from 26 march -29 march 2013 with my husband
The hotel is about 5 min  Walk to the train station and near to historical center
The hotel and our room were very clean
Breakfast was excellent and the breakfast room is fabulous
The hotelstaff were very friendly and helpful
Highly recomanded
Location, not so convenient
However across the train station
Internet was not complimentary because we booked through booking
The staff was friendly and kind
The building was old but well maintained and was presenting a historical mood

Access to the hotel is kind of uncomfortable, reception is in the second floor ,Super small elevator, and tiny circular stairs,i took a little time to get all of our stuff up there,but it is part of being in the center of Florence
You can really enjoy the town's amazing architecture
Good quality for a very low price
It is located at the center of the city
Personnel are very kind and helpful
I advise everyone who visits the city for touristic purposes or shopping
Entrance to the hotel is bit awkward
Need to take a small lift after 5-6 stairs to 3rd floor and lift is very small
but other than that it is a very nice hotel to stay
Very good location (between Duomo and SMNstation) , very nice design of hotel
Staff is wonderful- friendly, everytime with smile, tries to give you advise )
Breakfast with fantastic capucino- "delizioso"
Rooms are comfortable, nice, clean with everything you need for 4-5 days station here
The bathroom was clean, but too small and not so comfortable
The breakfast quality is high, but I found lack of variety (not a continental breakfast)
the room was tiny
I've never stayed in such a small room before
it might be enough space for a single room but not for a double one
So it was one of the reasons to feel a lack of comfort, the other one - no heating, very cold floor
I had to force myself to leave my bed in the morning ( fortunately they have warm blankets)

Very dirty and dusty bed spreads , dining area filthy and was cleaned up after informing staff, Reception is situated on 3rd floor and accessible only from a tiny elavator and after negotiating a flight of steps with 3 suitcases from the front entrance
Would not recommend
The entrance is very difficult if u have large luggage or stroller, I say its a motel,not an hotel,the breakfast room just had 3 or 4 tables,with very poor breakfast
We stayed in a connecting room with a small bathroom in between us
A double bed in one room and 2 twin beds in the connecting room
A much older historic hotel facilities, but did include wifi. The staff were very welcoming and always willing to help
they even provided evening tea for us on request
Excellent breakfast for an Italian hotel
The rooms weremall but clean and easily accessibleVery good large secure car park
Peaceful setting in it's own grounds
Free secured broadband internet and Sky TV including sports channels all be it in Italian
Decent sized room and bed
Above all the staff were very friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble for them
Wifi was poor to non existent in rooms
The walk to the train is not on a very good road
Probably a bit difficult for families or elderly
The hotel rooms were very clean and as advertized
Breakfast was good and free parking and location suitable for people traveling with car
Nice location but far to the center of Napoli
There is a train but the station is difficult to find and we had to wait the train a very long time
Swimming pool and environment are very pleasant
Montespina Park hotel is a perfect spot for exploring Naples and its surroundings
The hotel has a fantastic swimming-pool and the breakfast buffet is excellent, including many 'dolci'
The service, especially from Nuncia, who remembers the favourite coffee choice from all the guests, was excellent
Staff is friendly, reception very helpful
Great choice for family with kids
We had the quadruple room with extra bed
Breakfast good, room is clean, free parking Internet
Easy access to essentials like a bank, I was directed to one which was about a kilometre on foot along busy rd only to find it all in Italian which I could not understand
Maybe a little more assistance or knowledge from the hotel would have saved me being left to seek out somebody on the street to help as the bank certainly did not care
Nice swimming pool but hotel food was way over priced couldnt eat there
Friendly and cooperative staff, nice rooms, hotel beautiful surrounded in the park which is relaxing in a city like Neapel, great pool area
If we have a chance to stay again we will do so
breakfast, family room, staff very friendly, hotel in a very good position, placed in a lovely park, you don't have the feeling to be in the chaotic Naples
Public transportation is not easily accessable, not reliable (not punctual), and in a very dirty area of city
It did not feel safe to walk around outside the gated area at night
There is a lot of trash along the sidewalks just down the street from the hotel
And no matter what time of the day, the roads do not have a safe way to cross
The only thing that I consider as a disadvantage is the location
Even though it is close to subway, it takes to long to be able to reach to the centre of city
And there was a strange smell in the room which might be because of the new wallpaper
Otherwise everything was perfect
The hotel is well cleaned
The staff are friendly and professional
The WIFI is free of charge and the breakfast offer an extensive variety of option
Been there several times and always happy to go back
The staff are very helpful
The location is very close to train station, just across the road, very convenient the room is big enough & clean
Breakfaat was good choices there
We wouldn't mind to come back & stay there again
We had pretty big room
This hotel has generally enough space everywhere
Staff was very helpful doing their utmost
Breakfast is good, but no hot dishes like scrambled eggs or sausages
Small parking on the back yard available for free
Hotel is not in center but train stop is next to hotel and it is easy and fast to get to central railway station of Naples
The friendly and courteous Staff,especially David,at the Reception,who was most helpful
Also,the spacious Room we were given
Very clean and convenient hotel, close to the train station (with train towards the city historical centre) and wih a private parking
Nice breakfast, friendly staff
Great location
train station to center of town is across the street
We drove and parked and never used car after arrived
Staff were very helpful and friendly
Rooms very clean and bed was comfortable
The breakfast offered had a variety of food
Great value for money
Excellent hotel, very clean & comfortable room including refrigerator, excellent breakfast buffet
Run-down, dirty neighbourhood
No in-room tea making facility
Terrible location and surrounding
Doesn't live up to it's 4-star rating - everything is painfully average - not the most pleasant place to stay if travelling for leisure - fine for business I suppose
Awful wifi anywhere
Impossible to work
Hotel passed its prime 20y ago, especially bathrooms
But beds are also antics
Gym equipment are old and cranking
This result in the gym being empty, which is good since there are only a couple of machines
Breakfast is super basic Rooms with view on the central shaft are plain depressive
Not recommended even if the price is not bad for a room with bf
The breakfast was not sufficient
The wifi keeps resetting every 5 minutes and it was terribly slow
Also, the guy at the reception was not very helpful at all
We arrived early and wanted to have a city tour

We were said that we can leave our luggages and when the room is ready, our luggages will be taken to our room, but when we arrive in the evening, the luggages were not moved to our room and we had to move them
Which four star hotel does not have a bell boy
Air conditioning marginal
Location convenient to metro but little of interest near hotel including restaurants
The accommodations were spacious, comfortable, and clean
The breakfast was outstanding
The staff was friendly and spoke English
The hotel is situated directly opposite the railway station which makes traveling into Central Naples fairly convenient
There is also a good supermarket opposite which is great for supplies
Staff are very helpful at the hotel and are very happy to advise as required
Breakfast was good
The room had a balcony which was a bonus
Very helpful friendly staff
Although the area wasn't very clean I could not fault the cleanliness of the hotel
Would definitely recommend the place and stay again if I'm ever again in Naples
Not always good wifi quality
The location is hard to find and the neighborhood might be a little scary, although access to the city center via subway is excellent
Problems arise if you want to go somewhere at night
Great location and helpful staff
The location is great
I had an excellent view of the castle and the Naples bay
Location on the waterfront is excellent
Lots of places to eat and drink nearby
Very satisfied with the hotel

The balcony was very big and had great views across the bay
Beautiful large room with view of garden, garden room off our bedroom with steps out to the garden, gorgeous common rooms, delicious breakfast, sweet, helpful staff
I thought it was fabulous
Across the street from the Greek ruins of Paestum which were unbelievable
breakfast, family room, staff very friendly, hotel in a very good position, placed in a lovely park, you don't have the feeling to be in the chaotic Naples

If we have a chance to stay again we will do so

Very satisfied with the hotel

The place is amazing The king size bed,heated floor, beautiful bathroom, the service was sharp, the staff in the hotels knows you by you name and the and keep trying to make your stay the best they can and they can

Wonderful peaceful location Excellent views from rooms, restaurant, terraces & pool Excellent service from friendly, multi-lingual staff Delicious food Reasonable bar & minibar prices Lovely & comfortable rooms

Wonderful peaceful location Excellent views from rooms, restaurant, terraces & pool Excellent service from friendly, multi-lingual staff Delicious food Reasonable bar & minibar prices Lovely & comfortable rooms
Perfectly clean and nicely decorated, a million worth sea / panoramic view, very kind and helpful staff, ideal location if you want to have a tranquil rest
A restaurant/pizzeria with an excellent food and sea view is not far away
Mouthwatering warm and fresh pastries for the breakfast
Amalfi coast us beatufull with positano nearby
I stayed two nights and needed not to visit sorrento which we originally intended to
Once your hike the steps to the room everything us perfect
Good hot water and although no parking in facility we had no trouble parking car just outside residence
The Amalfi Residence was a charming and hospitable hotel nestled above Amalfi
We very much enjoyed our stay here
However, it needs to be said that it is a fifteen minute drive down to Amalfi along narrow, winding roads which we saw as somewhat of a drawback particularly at night
There are public busses, however the last one is 9pm from Amalfi
Fortunately there is a great restaurant round the corner from the hotel, so we were able to eat out in the evening
The rooms are nice but the furniture is basic and a bit old
Decoration of the rooms could be improved
The hotel location is really nice in terms of sea view but as it is located outside the main towns (Amalfi, Positano, etc), you need to use the public transportation (one bus every hour)
Taxis are very expensive if you spend a late night in Positano
Prices for the restaurant and bar are not advertised, you could argue if you stay in this hotel at the prices charged you do not need to ask
We thought eating in the restaurant was nice but expensive
Problems with WiFi in the room, although to be fair owner and staff called out the it engineer to fix, but was still hit and miss by the time we left
The people, the location, the peaceful atmosphere, and the food are all so wonderful
The staff was very welcoming and they helped my friend and I very much
We loved it so much, we ended up staying four days just at this hotel
I would certainly recommend this hotel to everyone and especially visiting Ischia rather than visiting the more touristy Capri
Thank you hotel torre sant'angelo
The hotel itself is beautiful and very eclectic
The staff is very professional and friendly
Free shuttle can be arranged to take you to the beach, city and/or for arrival/departure
Apart from 2 Michelin stars restaurant, there are also nice lunches served by the pool
Breakfasts are very good
the staff at the hotel were excellent
the spa facilities are superb
Besides being a nice hotel with a nice staff, you eat really well here
The view is incredible
The rooms are clean
And you have all that you need in a great hotel
Everything was perfect, one of the best hotels I've ever stay in
Limited amount of rooms makes the hotel - "like being at home", same with hotel's restaurant
Ischia island is a very nice place to be and spend a couple of weeks for vacation - great views, beautiful nature, friendly people
Termal recreations are great and relaxing
For a very reasonable prices, which is important
Scooter or car rent is a must, otherwise you will not be able to see all the beauty of the island
For the ones who are looking for shopping, night life, etc, - this is probably not the best place
